question: What is an operating system?
choice1: interface between the hardware and application programs
choice2: collection of programs that manages hardware resources
choice3: system service provider to the application programs

question: What is the main function of the command interpreter?
choice1: to provide the interface between the API and application program
choice2: to handle the files in the operating system
choice3: to get and execute the next user-specified command

question: In Operating Systems, which of the following is/are CPU scheduling algorithms?
To access the services of the operating system, the interface is provided by the ___________
CPU scheduling is the basis of ___________
Which one of the following is not true?
choice1: kernel remains in the memory during the entire computer session
choice2: kernel is made of various modules which can not be loaded in running operating system
choice3: kernel is the first part of the operating system to load into memory during booting
choice4: kernel is the program that constitutes the central core of the operating system

question: Which one of the following errors will be handle by the operating system?
Where is the operating system placed in the memory?
choice1: either low or high memory (depending on the location of interrupt vector

question: If a process fails, most operating system write the error information to a ______
Which one of the following is not a real time operating system?
What does OS X has?
In operating system, each process has its own __________
choice2: pending alarms, signals, and signal handlers

question: In a timeshare operating system, when the time slot assigned to a process is completed, the process switches from the current state to?

Cascading termination refers to the termination of all child processes if the parent process terminates ______Cascading termination refers to the termination of all child processes if the parent process terminates ______
When a process is in a “Blocked” state waiting for some I/O service. When the service is completed, it goes to the __________?
Transient operating system code is a code that ____________
The portion of the process scheduler in an operating system that dispatches processes is concerned with ____________
choice1: assigning ready processes to waiting queue
choice2: assigning running processes to blocked queue

question: The FCFS algorithm is particularly troublesome for ___________?
For an effective operating system, when to check for deadlock?
choice1: every time a resource request is made at fixed time intervals
choice3: ery time a resource request is made

question: A deadlock avoidance algorithm dynamically examines the __________ to ensure that a circular wait condition can never exist
Swapping _______ be done when a process has pending I/O, or has to execute I/O operations only into operating system buffers
The main memory accommodates ____________?
The operating system is responsible for?
The operating system and the other processes are protected from being modified by an already running process because ____________
choice1: every address generated by the CPU is being checked against the relocation and limit registers
choice3: they are in different memory spaces
choice4: they are in different logical addresses

question: Using transient code, _______ the size of the operating system during program execution.
The operating system maintains a ______ table that keeps track of how many frames have been allocated, how many are there, and how many are available.
To obtain better memory utilization, dynamic loading is used. With dynamic loading, a routine is not loaded until it is called. For implementing dynamic loading ____________
choice1: special support from operating system is essential
choice2: special support from hardware is required
choice3: user programs can implement dynamic loading without any special support from hardware or operating system
choice4: special support from both hardware and operating system is essential

question: The _________ presents a uniform device-access interface to the I/O subsystem, much as system calls provide a standard interface between the application and the operating system.
In real time operating system ____________
choice1: process scheduling can be done only once
choice2: all processes have the same priority
choice4: a task must be serviced by its deadline period
